page.title: 11The Friends School In 1985.
page.content: Since 1841 the Friends School has dominated the High Green in the village of Great Ayton.Built by{Thomas {Richardson}who was born in 1771,the school was originally intended to cater for labouring Societies as well as local children.The boarding fees used to be Â£8 per year are now over Â£3,000. In 1985 the Friends School still stands on High Green.Owned by the Quakers,it's still an attractive building.One section is a delicate shade of pink.The present head Mr Sessa is American.Teaching staff consists of 19 full time and 8 part time staff.Children are divided into classes of 20.7_10 year olds can be day pupils 11_18 year olds can board. Musical instruments are taught piano and clarinet being the most popular. Animals are not used in science work.
